name: C++ Map
description: C++ <map> are associative containers that store elements formed by a combination of a key value and a mapped value, following a specific order

Iterators.val: Returns an iterator referring to the first element in the map container
Returns an iterator referring to the past-the-end element in the map container
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the last element in the container
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the theoretical element right before the first element in the map container
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the first element in the container
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the past-the-end element in the container
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the last element in the container
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the theoretical element preceding the first element in the container

Capacity.val: Returns the number of elements in the map container
Returns the maximum number of elements that the map container can hold
Returns whether the map container is empty

Element Access.val: Returns a reference to the value that is mapped to a key equivalent to key, performing an insertion if such key does not already exist
Returns a reference to the mapped value of the element identified with key k

Modifiers.val: Inserts element(s) into the container, if the container doesn't already contain an element with an equivalent key
Removes from the map container either a single element or a range of elements
Exchanges the content of the container by the content of x, which is another map of the same type
Removes all elements from the map container (which are destroyed), leaving the container with a size of 0
Inserts a new element in the map if its key is unique. This new element is constructed in place using args as the arguments for the construction of a value_type
Inserts a new element in the map if its key is unique, with a hint on the insertion position. This new element is constructed in place using args as the arguments for the construction of a value_type

Observers.val: Returns a reference to the value that is mapped to a key equivalent to key, performing an insertion if such key does not already exist
Returns a reference to the mapped value of the element identified with key k

Non-member Functions.val: Returns a reference to the ith element of array arr
Performs the appropriate comparison operation between the array containers lhs and rhs

Helper Classes.val: Accesses the static type of the elements in an array object as if it was a tuple
Provides access to the number of elements in an std::array as a compile-time constant expression
